intro: Justicia velascana, commonly known as the Mexican flame flower, is a flowering plant native to Central America and the Caribbean. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces striking red or orange tubular flowers, which are highly attractive to pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and have a distinctive grayish-green color. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes in warm climates.
